data.title: Add subword cursors - take 4
data.body:
Add commands for moving, selecting, and deleting camelCase words.

Fixes #1982 and an alternative to #3961. Also, hopefully can used with atom/vim-mode#377.

Replaces #4429.

data.title: Editor Keeps Crashing
data.body: From the time I installed Atom on my Win8 PC it keeps crashing as soon as I open it. An error message said to report the issue here. Please provide some solution to this problem.

data.title: Cursor scope incomplete when tag is closed (html)
data.body:
Atom version 0.184.0
Mac OSX 10.10.1

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open HTML file
2. Type `<div s` (cursor should be after the "s")
3. Run the following in the console:
   
   ```
   editor = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()
   cursor = editor.getLastCursor()
   cursor.getScopes() // **rightly** produces: ["text.html.basic", "meta.tag.block.any.html", "entity.other.attribute-name.html"]
   ```
4. Type `<div s >`
5. Move cursor back to after the "s"
6. Run `cursor.getScopes()` in the console:
   
   ```
   // cursor.getScopes() **wrongly** produces: ["text.html.basic", "meta.tag.block.any.html"]
   ```

data.title: Atom gets caught in loop, can't escape until force quit.
data.body:
I cloned anchor-cms without creating a fork. So, I don't actually have permission to push to the repository. If I make a change to any of the files, I am prompted for a password. Entering my password, or canceling just causes another error, and another password prompt. I can't interact with any of the red error box's because the password prompt blocks the rest of the editor from responding.

If I just wait and do nothing long enough, I am given the option to close the editor.

![screen shot 2015-02-28 at 9 58 03 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1014630/6429281/bad777d8-bf95-11e4-95a0-e398f7d4b6b7.png)

data.title: In RDP Session Text Cursor is not visible because it is black
data.body:
Hey All,

Just want to say that ATOM is awesome! I am having the following issue where I use ATOM in an RDP environment. When moving the mouse into the editor portion of ATOM it completely disappears, if you type some text into the editor and try to move the mouse over the text it is still visible, just black. Once you move the cursor up to the tabs, it shows up again as a white pointer. Is it possible to fix this?

Windows 8.1
RDP 7
ATOM - .184.0

Thanks!

data.title: Atom installer creates a ridiculous number of temporary files
data.body:
All of these files are 0 bytes in size, and lead to major system instability, as they pile up over time, and are never deleted.  After one install, there were 31,458 leftover temp files.

Install Log: https://gist.github.com/Quantum64/228eb1704fe7e83c4d1d

![c91a0cdf421753a27932ee0d216dad4e](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3969183/6424631/e6c40662-bece-11e4-92ff-db9a171ece1a.png)

Running OS Windows 10 Build 9926

/cc @paulcbetts #5671

data.title: Default directory provider should handle only local filesystem directories
data.body:
I'm having an issue of:
When I add an atom directory provider with uri like: myuri://server:port/some_path and reload atom or close/open atom, the default directory provider normalizes my uri path (bc it calls path.normalize on it eve though it's not a local filesystem directory).
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/default-directory-provider.coffee#L16-L24

How do you think about the following solution:
1- The deafult directory provider returns a directory only when it exists on the filesystem.
2- On deserializing and creating the project with paths, if a projectPath can't be handled by a directory provider, it's added to another array to be consumed later by atom packages, when they are loaded

That's trying to work-around the nature of atom core initializing before packages are loaded and able to provide their directory providers.

data.title: Failed to load config.cson / [stdin]:1:1 error: unexpected, config.cson filled with whitespaces

![0](http://i.imgur.com/DqXICg5.png)

```
Windows 10 Build 9926
Atom version 0.182.0

Community Packages:
atom-lint
minimap
recent-files
recent-projects
```

The contents of the file are exactly 238 whitespaces. I have no idea why it's that, I didn't modify anything on my own.

data.title: Feature Request -- Ability to open new files straight into a new pane
data.body:
I really like having different panes but that aren't very friendly to the keyboard.

For example if I want to open a new file into a split right pane, I have to open an EXISTING file into the pane, have two copies of it open long enough for me to CLICK into the new file then open the file I want on the right side of my screen. Then I close the duplicate file that allowed me to have the pane open in the first place. 

Alot of effort.

I'd love the ability to open a new pane at least from the Fuzzy File Finder, something like maybe an alt-enter or command+1 for "Open in nth pane" would be such a huge improvement.

data.title: Select all very slow when lots of folded content
data.body:
Doing <ctrl>a to select the complete buffer, when most of the content is hidden in folded sections is very slow, and it unfolds everything.

I do not see why either of those should happen.

I do this regularly with some javascript files.  I start with everything folded, expand a small section, make changes, then select / copy the whole buffer to paste into jslint.com.  I have not gotten around to installing the jslint package.

data.title: The editor has crashed
data.body:
The sequence that lead to the crash, although simple testing could not reproduce:

Search and replace using regex (including using $1 for replace)
Go to do another search, but did not switch off regex mode
First character of the search was "."
The editor 'froze' doing the match for any character
Got a not responding message
Told it to keep waiting
After awhile longer, crash

The crash did not provide a stack trace or other information.  Below is an extract from a previous report that did have the details.  This should still be all current.

**Atom Version**: 0.182.0-d1e6dba
**System**: linux 3.18.7-200.fc21.i686
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {},
  "editor": {
    "invisibles": {},
    "autoIndentOnPaste": false,
    "showInvisibles": true,
    "fontSize": 14
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
tabs-to-spaces, v0.8.1

# Dev
No dev packages
```

``` perl
my $sth = $dbh->prepare(q~

        ,TableB.s_email                                                         AS UserEMail

~);
```

Atom 0.184.0 on Ubuntu 14.10 x64

data.title: Add CHANGELOG
data.body:
If you start with GitHub as an entry point for Atom (as opposed to https://atom.io), it can be a bit difficult to find Atom's release notes quickly. If you're lucky you might come across the `release-notes` package, but that too doesn't contain the release notes (somewhat paradoxically). Of course, you could always browse through the Releases on GitHub, but that also has a bit more noise if all you want to see are the changes.

This adds a CHANGELOG.md that literally just links to https://atom.io/releases to avoid duplication and to make Atom's release notes a bit more discoverable.

data.title: Don't show foldable icon on soft wrapped lines
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5739.
-  574158d adds a failing spec to demonstrate the problem. Running the specs results in this (expected) output:
  
  ```
  TextEditorComponent
  gutter rendering
    fold decorations
      rendering fold decorations
        when soft wrapping is enabled
          it doesn't add the foldable class for soft-wrapped lines
            Expected true to be false. (spec/text-editor-component-spec.coffee:650:55)
  ```
- 09ed657 adds a check in the GutterComponent so that fold icons are added only on the first physical line of soft wrapped lines. Running the specs doesn't trigger the failure above. 

Before :tv::

![foldy2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/6414319/b256fdae-be96-11e4-9d66-41d966d1c8c0.gif)

After :tv::

![foldy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/6414246/351efff8-be96-11e4-84e6-7813df93647c.gif)

cc @benogle @nathansobo for :eyes:

Hi,
with Atom Version 0.184.0, Windows 8.1 x64, no custom keymap, only the default keybindings and all community packages disabled:
I'm not able to write an "@"-Symbol in the editor using a German keyboard and Alt-Gr + q.

data.title: Feature Request: search history
data.body: What I miss in Atom which I remember from some other editor(s), is that the 'search' text box of the find dialog, has a drop-down-arrow (or combo-box or what to call it) with a list of the _x_ most recent entries you've searched for.

data.title: Close atom without save file, and keep change in file
data.body: How to close atom without save file like sublime text?

data.title: Why not "npm install -g atom" ?
data.body:
I've not digged into build procedure yet, but it looks like depending only on node-related technologies, which is why I wonder why the build process is not a simple `npm install`.

What would we gain?
- `npm install -g atom` as an alternative way of installing, easier, maybe slower (gyp compilation being made at install time)
- for those who install from source, `npm link` from the source folder and _voila_ your editor is installed globally and automatically updated when you rebuild your source folder

Is that something possible?

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getPath' of null tree-view.js:827
data.body:
I get this error when trying to open a folder ("Application: Open a folder") :

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getPath' of null /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/tree-view/lib/tree-view.js:827
```

In case that's relevant: this happened after the editor crashed when I wanted to run the command "Application: Run Benchmarks" and I restarted it. Before this crash, opening a folder worked correctly as far as I can remember.

data.title: can't drag tab to window without anything open.
data.body:
How to reproduce: open two Atom windows, open one or more files in window 1, close all tabs in window 2. Drag a tab from window 1 to window 2. Window 2 doesn't appear to accept this tab. If window 2 does have one or more tabs open, it does accept tabs dragged onto it.

I'm not sure if it's a bug or a feature, but I can't think of a reason why an empty window shouldn't accept tabs dragged onto it.

(I'm on Windows 7 with Atom 0.182.0)

data.title: Support running atom commands from CLI
data.body:
It would enable a number of useful scenarios to allow specifying commands to execute from the CLI when opening Atom.

For example, using the [merge-conflicts](https://atom.io/packages/merge-conflicts) package, it would be possible to use Atom as a merge resolution tool that could be launched from a source control client:

```
atom --exec 'merge-conflicts:detect' path/to/repository 
```

There are undoubtedly other, better ways for this syntax to work, but using the same commands that appear in Keybinding settings in the UI would be good for usability. 

If there are other scenarios people can think of that would benefit from being able to do something more complex than running a single command, that feedback would be useful here as well to help define how this could work.

data.title: Allow html imports with inline scripts
data.body:
I'm trying to use html imports to pull in custom element definitions that have inline scripts, but running into CSP restrictions.

Adding `'unsafe-inline'` to `script-src` would solve this issue.

Eventually Chrome might add a `'unsafe-static-inline'` to allow only static inline scripts: those that are created directly by the parser, not via script like `innerHTML = ...`. See: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=393307

data.title: Atom stops opening files
data.body: Under some (potentially all) conditions, atom squelches errors in the callback to atom.workspace.eachEditor (something something domains).  The result is that atom stops opening files with no user feedback as to why.  I'm not sure if the same problem exists with observe, but I'm guessing the answer is yes.  Plugins should not be able to interfere with the editor.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getScreenPosition' of undefined
data.body:
Consistent repro steps in safe mode:
1. create empty coffee spec file
2. type `req` then tab
3. type some things. I typed `grim`
4. hit `esc` to clear the multiple cursors
5. move to end of line
6. make some new lines
7. type `be` then tab
8. :boom: 

This has bracket matcher in the trace, but I'm not sure who the originator is. 

See https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/issues/88

**Atom Version**: 0.185.0-30e3813
**System**: Mac OS X 10.9.5
**Thrown From**: [bracket-matcher](https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher) package, v0.71.0

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getScreenPosition' of undefined
